title: Argentina Megastar Becomes ‘Tattooed’ Heir To Legendary Compatriot At Inter Milan
description: Inter Milan long-serving stalwart Lautaro Martinez is following in the footsteps of his legendary compatriot Javier Zanetti.According to La Repubblica via FCInterNews, El Toro has become a ‘tattooed...
fullText:
Inter Milan long-serving stalwart Lautaro Martinez is following in the footsteps of his legendary compatriot Javier Zanetti.

According to La Repubblica via FCInterNews, El Toro has become a ‘tattooed’ heir of the iconic Nerazzurri captain.

Inter’s decision to sign Lautaro Martinez from Racing Club in 2018 may have been the club’s best piece of business in the past 20 years.

Indeed, the Argentine center-forward has established himself as the symbol of the club during his seven-year stint in Lombardy.

Furthermore, he has never shown any ambition to leave, suggesting he could finish his career at Giuseppe Meazza.

SEATTLE, WASHINGTON – JUNE 21: Lautaro Martinez #10 of FC Internazionale Milano looks on during the FIFA Club World Cup 2025 group E match between FC Internazionale Milano and Urawa Red Diamonds at Lumen Field on June 21, 2025 in Seattle, Washington. (Photo by Buda Mendes/Getty Images)

Lautaro’s winning goal against Atalanta on Sunday extended his goals tally for the club to a jaw-dropping 166.

Therefore, he’s now Inter’s fourth all-time leading goalscorer, trailing Roberto Boninsegna by five.

At 28, Lautaro can still play at the top level for at least half a decade.

With that in mind, it’s only reasonable to expect the skilled striker to hit a 200-goal landmark.

Already now, it’s hard to escape the proposition that Lautaro is a modern-day Zanetti figure – a captain defined not just by longevity, but by loyalty.

title: 6 NFL coaches on the hot seat for Black Monday
description: Will the ax fall on Kevin Stefanski, Mike McDaniel or Shane Steichen? We'll know the day after the 2025 NFL regular season wraps.
fullText:
For 18 teams, the 2026 NFL season begins once Week 18 ends. For a select few, that means leaving losing coaches behind and starting fresh. While there are always a handful of firings across the course of the season — this year that included Tennessee Titans play-caller Brian Callahan and New York Giants former NFL coach of the year Brian Daboll — there's no worse day to be a struggling NFL coach than the day after the season is finished.

Black Monday is the scourge of underperforming playbook architects. It will claim a handful of careers to ring in the new year January 5, opening the door to coaching interviews and new hires that will energize fan bases across the world — though whether that's a good thing or bad thing will hinge heavily on the candidate. So who could be the recipient of bad headlines the first day after the 2025 NFL regular season ends?

Glenn should be at the top of this list, but New York's reported insistence it will keep him suggests he's safe barring an absolute disaster in Week 18. We cannot rule this out, because absolute disaster has been a hallmark of Glenn's first season as an NFL head coach.

He started his tenure with seven straight losses. Somehow, the four-game losing streak in which he's currently mired feels worse; his Jets have been outscored by an average margin of just under 27 points per game — and that includes showdowns with sub-.500 teams like the Dolphins and New Orleans Saints. Injuries and trades have depleted both sides of the ball, but you'd be hard pressed to find anything New York does well in 2025.

Justin Fields, Glenn's flier QB addition, has been either injured or terrible this fall. Garrett Wilson's injury turned the receiving corps into a host of replacement-caliber players. None of the team's three starting wideouts in Week 17 began their season on the Jets' active roster. Sauce Gardner and Quinnen Williams were traded in-season. Qwan'tez Stiggers, Dean Clark and Jarvis Brownlee have all made multiple starts in the secondary — a group that has yet to record an interception this fall.

Keeping Glenn suggests owner Woody Johnson is chalking a brutal 2025 up to an undermanned depth chart and some bad personnel decisions. Still, it's tough to look at the Jets defense and its massive regression from Robert Saleh's peak and think Glenn has the ability to map out a cogent plan as the season wears on and the world changes around him.

He's set to get another try with multiple first round draft picks and more than $90 million in salary cap room for 2026. Failing there could set the Jets up for another generation of regret.

Stefanski is Cleveland's Sisyphus, only if management stepped in to give him a larger, heavier boulder after he'd cleared the halfway point of his mountain. The coach who guided Baker Mayfield to the franchise's first playoff win since 1994 and won 11 games by making Joe Flacco the NFL comeback player of the year (in just six games) has been constantly hamstrung by his franchise's inability to find a viable quarterback.

Cleveland traded three first round picks before handing Deshaun Watson a fully guaranteed $230 million despite more than 20 accusations of sexual misconduct and what the NFL itself described as "predatory behavior" dating to his time in Houston. For the privilege of blocking the team's most obvious pathways to roster improvement, Watson has played 19 games in four seasons and been the NFL's 48th-best quarterback when on the field.

His absence has cleared the way for the Browns to improve from 32nd in scoring offense last season to... 31st. The offensive line, once a strength, has devolved into one of the league's worst units. Bright spots remain thanks to Quinshon Judkins and Harold Fannin Jr., but there may not be a coach alive or dead who could coax this team to a respectable record.

After that playoff win in his debut, Stefanski has had a losing record in four of the last five seasons. He deserves better. Cleveland firing him could clear him up to actually receive it. Expecting the Browns to do better with his replacement, however, is a tough ask.

Morris got the Atlanta job over Bill Belichick. While he's been better (and less of a circus) than the nine-time Super Bowl winner has at North Carolina, he hasn't inspired confidence. Somehow, remarkably, Morris found a way to beat the Buffalo Bills but lose to the New York Jets — threading a needle that completes the world's tackiest jacket.

Quarterback play has been an issue, with Michael Penix Jr.'s injury giving way to a diminished Kirk Cousins and spurts of inspiring play cropping up like islands in a sea of mediocrity. Atlanta has a galaxy of high level skill players, but thanks to injury and ineffectiveness ranks only 22nd in expected points added (EPA) per play this fall. Pouring draft capital into the pass rush has improved the defense, but that unit has gone from 20th in EPA allowed to... 19th.

Outside help will be difficult to find. Releasing or trading Cousins would shave up to $35 million from the team's 2026 salary cap — useful, considering it's already over the estimated spending limit next fall — but may not be practical with Penix recovering from his third ACL tear. The team's first round pick is owed to the Los Angeles Rams as a result of the trade that made James Pearce a Falcon (he was drafted with the 26th overall selection. Atlanta's pick is shaping up to land in or around the top 10. It's not ideal!).

That could give Morris one more chance to clean up the mess he's maintained for the past two seasons. If he can fix the defense and lean on guys like Drake London and Bijan Robinson on offense, it could be enough to rise to the top of the NFC South's shallow pool. The help will have to mostly come from within the franchise. With a still-young core, the opportunity for a turnaround will persist. So far, Morris has proven incapable of seizing it.

How much of the Colts' injury-related crashout will be heaped at the feet of Steichen and general manager Chris Ballard? Indianapolis was once 7-1. Now it's at risk of finishing 2025 with a losing record.

Steichen and Ballard came into the year on the hot seat, emerged as potential award winners over the first half of the season and then shrank from the spotlight as things went sour. Injuries to Daniel Jones and Anthony Richardson didn't help, but that doesn't explain a defense that ranked 10th in expected points added (EPA) per play allowed in the first half of the season slid to 23rd in the second half. Sure, a rise of three-and-outs from an offense eventually commandeered by a 44-year-old Philip Rivers didn't help. Even so, that's a dramatic backslide for a team that held three opponents to 14 points or fewer through Week 8 and has held a single opponent to fewer than 20 points in the nine weeks since.

The Colts are heading into their first full offseason without former owner Jim Irsay at the helm in four decades. Current principal owner Carlie Irsay-Gordon and her sisters have been raised in a football world and understand the big swings he took to make Indianapolis great for a long stretch (and bad-to-mediocre for a longer one). Would they opt for a clean break to start fresh this January? Or did Jones' revival and subsequent injury create enough plausible deniability to run it back next fall?

Injury luck has been unkind to Gannon, certainly. But it doesn't excuse the fact he's won 30 percent of his games in Arizona over nearly three full seasons. With Kyler Murray shut down for the season (officially due to a foot injury, but unofficially because he was uninspiring and lacked the efficiency and consistency of, big sigh, Jacoby Brissett), the Cardinals have lost eight straight games. Despite a 3-13 record, they may not wind up with a top-three draft pick from it thanks to the league's hardest strength of schedule.

Even without a top-two pick in a two-quarterback draft (we'll see how the spring workouts shake out for Ty Simpson et al), we may have seen the end of the Murray era in Arizona. The former first overall pick has played more than 11 games only once in his last four seasons. His 0.084 EPA per dropback ranks 23rd among 53 quarterbacks to play at least 500 snaps in that stretch, which isn't terrible but also hasn't resulted in success. The Cardinals haven't had a winning season since 2021.

Trading away Murray would create more than $35 million in salary cap savings and a clean slate for a team unable to get out of its own way. Would Arizona trust a new franchise quarterback to the head coach who engineered a top-three offense in Philadelphia to get the job, then built the league's 17th-best offense in the three years that followed? While Gannon coaxed another forgettably solid year out of Brissett, his lack of wins suggests the ceiling for another veteran QB wouldn't be much higher in 2026.

McDaniel has been able to make more from less, turning around a team that looked absolutely cooked to start the season (1-6) en route to a .500-ish record. That's happened without Tyreek Hill in the lineup and followed the benching of Tua Tagovailoa. Rookie seventh round pick Quinn Ewers may not be the team's future, but McDaniel installed an offense around him that allowed him to beat the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Week 17 to further dim the Bucs' Super Bowl hopes.

That's all encouraging. It does not change the fact McDaniel failed to make Tagovailoa more than a fantasy football star, an 0-2 playoff record or a 9-14 record in December or later. The unconventional head coach has done a great job adding a slick layer of sheen atop his franchise that begins to flake apart under modest scrutiny. He's had one season with a top 20 scoring defense. He hasn't cracked the top 20 in scoring offense either of the last two years.

Like Gannon above, McDaniel's franchise is on the verge of swapping out a once-touted, highly paid and since-benched quarterback in service of a fresh start. But Tagovailoa's contract, injury history and the smoldering crater his 2025 play created makes him considerably more difficult to trade and there's nearly $100 million worth of dead salary attached to the $212 million extension he signed in (deep exhale) 2024. Miami isn't bad enough to land a top prospect on an inexpensive salary in the draft. Its best option may be hoping for a Sam Darnold or Baker Mayfield-type revival from a journeyman veteran.

That could benefit McDaniel, who supercharged Tagovailoa just long enough to be an albatross around the team's neck and just won a game with a seventh round rookie behind center. McDaniel's place in Kyle Shanahan's coaching tree suggests a special appreciation for getting the most out of flawed passers. But four seasons of underwhelming returns and no playoff success to speak of may shuffle him back to the coordinator ranks for a few years instead.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: 6 NFL coaches on the hot seat for Black Monday

title: Inter Milan Boss Cristian Chivu Contemplating Major Midfield Tweak Amid Poland Megastar’s Revival
description: Inter Milan manager Cristian Chivu is reportedly considering a significant midfield adjustment as Piotr Zielinski rediscovers his top form.According to Gazzetta dello Sport via FCInter1908, the Nerazz...
fullText:
Inter Milan manager Cristian Chivu is reportedly considering a significant midfield adjustment as Piotr Zielinski rediscovers his top form.

According to Gazzetta dello Sport via FCInter1908, the Nerazzurri could play with two playmakers from now on.

Hakan Calhanoglu has been Inter’s deep-lying playmaker for years, nailing down the role as his own.

Indeed, the 31-year-old Turkish star has been phenomenal since joining the club from AC Milan in 2021.

Furthermore, Simone Inzaghi’s decision to deploy him deeper in midfield has allowed Calhanoglu to dictate play with greater control

LEVERKUSEN, GERMANY – DECEMBER 10: Piotr Zielinski of FC Internazionale runs with the ball during the UEFA Champions League 2024/25 League Phase MD6 match between Bayer 04 Leverkusen and FC Internazionale Milano at BayArena on December 10, 2024 in Leverkusen, Germany. (Photo by Lars Baron/Getty Images)

Despite Calhanoglu’s consistency, Inter could add another playmaker to their starting lineup.

It’s none other than Zielinski.

Following a dreadful first season at San Siro, Zielinski has hit the ground running under Cristian Chivu.

Indeed, the Polish midfielder has been in scintillating form this term, leapfrogging Henrikh Mkhitaryan in the pecking order.

Moreover, Zielinski’s playmaking skills and technical prowess are well-documented.

Therefore, he can perfectly co-exist with Calhanoglu on the pitch, offering Inter more creativity and fluidity in the final third.

title: Giants' Mike Kafka doesn't 'have any doubt' Jaxson Dart is a franchise QB
description: New York Giants interim head coach Mike Kafka: "I don't have any doubts" that Jaxson Dart is a franchise quarterback.
fullText:
New York Giants interim head coach Mike Kafka offered glowing praise for rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart on Monday, declaring unequivocally that the young signal-caller has already established himself as the team's franchise quarterback.

"I don't have any doubts about that," Kafka said when asked if he believes Dart is a legitimate NFL franchise quarterback.

Dart, who entered the season as the backup before taking over as a starter, has impressed Kafka with his natural leadership that extends beyond the offense.

"I've seen Jaxson just become more comfortable in that role," Kafka said. "It's not about forcing anything, it's just about being himself and leading the way that he sees it and bringing guys along with him. Those are the qualities that we've seen since the first day he's gotten here."

Kafka noted that Dart's influence has reached the defense, with players there citing his leadership.

"I don't think there's an age requirement for leadership, whether you're young or old or a veteran or one year or one month or however many," Kafka said. "I just think if you have the leadership qualities, if you have the ability to, number one, lead yourself and then lead others, and guys will follow you based on how you operate and how you carry yourself, then I don't think there's necessarily like a prerequisite for that.

"I mean, Jaxson does a great job because he's just being himself and he's controlling what he can control. He's doing all the things that make him great and he's just being himself. He's not trying to be somebody else. He's just his genuine self."

On Dart's development, Kafka highlighted the typical leap from Year 1 to Year 2.

"I think you learn so much faster from year one to year two. You have that full season, you're in the NFL style, you kind of know how things operate. You've built somewhat of a framework of a routine on how you want to prepare yourself," he said. "Now you have time after this season to go through, kind of refine the things that you want, how you want to operate in the offseason, and now you have some time to kind of look back and really dissect yourself and really can make some more steps to improvement."

Kafka, who has coached Dart since his rookie arrival, called him "a pleasure to coach."

"He's been awesome. Learning every single day, absorbing as much information as he can, and then also putting his own fingerprint on things," he said. "You see a player that's continuing to learn from the good, the bad, and then continuing to take steps forward... take ownership and take accountability and hold other guys accountable."

"I'm proud to be working with him and happy for him, and I'm excited to continue to do that," Kafka concluded.

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: Giants' Mike Kafka doesn't 'have any doubt' Jaxson Dart is a franchise QB

title: Revealed: Hojlund already has hefty release clause at Napoli
description: Rasmus Hojlund has been on impressive form for Napoli in recent weeks, and reports on Tuesday confirm that there will be a release clause in his contract if, or rather when his permanent transfer from...

title: Report – Inter Milan Ready To Loan Italy Midfielder Out To Juventus In January On One Condition
description: Serie A giants Inter Milan could reportedly loan Davide Frattesi out to bitter rivals Juventus this winter on one condition.According to Tuttosport via FCInterNews, the Italian midfielder’s transfer...
fullText:
Serie A giants Inter Milan could reportedly loan Davide Frattesi out to bitter rivals Juventus this winter on one condition.

According to Tuttosport via FCInterNews, the Italian midfielder’s transfer to Turin remains a genuine possibility.

Deemed surplus to requirements at San Siro, Davide Frattesi is open to leaving the club in January.

Indeed, the 26-year-old is desperate to feature for Italy at next summer’s FIFA World Cup.

However, his limited playing time at Inter threatens to undermine his chances of making the Azzurri’s tournament squad.

MILAN, ITALY – OCTOBER 05: Davide Frattesi of FC Internazionale kicks a ball during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and Torino FC at Stadio Giuseppe Meazza on October 05, 2024 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Aware of Frattesi’s desire to leave, Inter will reportedly listen to offers for the former Sassuolo star.

Yet, the Serie A leaders have already slapped a substantial €35 million price tag on their wantaway ace.

Meanwhile, Juventus manager Luciano Spalletti is looking to offer Frattesi an escape route from Giuseppe Meazza.

Yet, the record-time Italian champions are only willing to sign the player on loan.

On the other hand, Inter would be ready to sanction a deal only if Juventus agree to include an obligatory buyout clause.

title: Inter Milan Vs Bologna – Italian Veteran & French Striker Unavailable For Selection
description: Inter Milan stars Matteo Darmian and Ange-Yoan Bonny are on the verge of missing the upcoming home clash against Bologna.According to Corriere dello Sport via FCInter1908, Sunday’s fixture will come...
fullText:
Inter Milan stars Matteo Darmian and Ange-Yoan Bonny are on the verge of missing the upcoming home clash against Bologna.

According to Corriere dello Sport via FCInter1908, Sunday’s fixture will come too soon for the injured duo.

Matteo Darmian last featured for Inter in September when he sustained a long-term muscle injury.

Indeed, the veteran defender has been in the pits since Inter’s 3-0 home triumph over Slavia Prague in the Champions League.

However, he could stay out of action until mid-January.

MONZA, ITALY – AUGUST 12: Ange-Yoan Bonny of FC Internazionale looks on during the Pre-season Friendly match between AC Monza and FC Internazionale at U-Power Stadium on August 12, 2025 in Monza, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

In addition to Darmian, Cristian Chivu will likely be without Bonny this weekend.

Bonny suffered a minor knee injury in training last week and had to skip Inter’s trip to Bergamo on Sunday.

Despite Chivu’s hopes of having the French striker available this weekend, Bonny’s recovery could take longer than expected.

With Marcus Thuram unable to rediscover his form since returning from injury, Francesco Pio Esposito could start in attack.

title: Mateta, Nuñez and more: Milan’s options to replace Nkunku
description: Milan are exploring options to potentially replace Christopher Nkunku, and according to Gazzetta, Jean-Philippe Mateta and Darwin Nuñez are on the Rossoneri’s agenda.Multiple sources in Italy claim...
fullText:
Milan are exploring options to potentially replace Christopher Nkunku, and according to Gazzetta, Jean-Philippe Mateta and Darwin Nuñez are on the Rossoneri’s agenda.

Multiple sources in Italy claim that Turkish side Fenerbahce have sent an opening offer to sign Milan striker Nkunku, and the Rossoneri are currently making assessments on the Frenchman’s future at San Siro.

According to Gazzetta, the Rossoneri have already set their sights on several strikers who can potentially replace Nkunku in the January window.

MILAN, ITALY – NOVEMBER 29: Christopher Nkunku of AC Milan is challenged by Matias Vecino of Lazio during the Serie A match between AC Milan and SS Lazio at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on November 29, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Sidiki Cherif of Angers, scorer of four goals in the Ligue 1 this season, is among the Milan options and the report claims that the two clubs have already begun preliminary talks.

However, with Francesco Camarda expected to return from a loan spell at Lecce next summer, the Rossoneri might decide against signing another young striker.

Darwin Nuñez was a player Milan sounded out last summer and Gazzetta confirms that the ex-Liverpool man already wants to leave Al-Hilal, but the Saudi side’s demands will likely be pretty high.

CRAWLEY, ENGLAND – JULY 25: Jean-Phillipe Mateta of Crystal Palace looks on during the pre-season friendly match between Crawley Town and Crystal Palace at Broadfield Stadium on July 25, 2025 in Crawley, England. (Photo by Bryn Lennon/Getty Images)

The same goes for Jean-Philippe Mateta, a long-time Milan target, but Crystal Palace are unwilling to sell for less than €40m.

Mauro Icardi and  Joshua Zirkzee have Serie A experience and might be allowed to leave in January, but only in the second half of the month, as Galatasaray and Manchester United are short of options in attack due to the AFCON.

Last but not least is Rayan of Vasco Da Gama. The Brazilian is not exactly a centre-forward as he prefers playing as a winger or as an attacking winger.

Despite having an €80m release clause, he might leave for a lower fee because the Brazilian club are in a poor financial situation, but the competition for the 19-year-old will be fierce.

title: Inter Milan Back On Track – Euphoria Returns To San Siro After Morale-Boosting Atalanta Victory
description: Inter Milan bounced back from a morale-wracking Supercoppa Italiana exit with a huge Serie A win at Atalanta last weekend.According to Gazzetta dello Sport via FCInterNews, a hard-earned victory in Be...
fullText:
Inter Milan bounced back from a morale-wracking Supercoppa Italiana exit with a huge Serie A win at Atalanta last weekend.

According to Gazzetta dello Sport via FCInterNews, a hard-earned victory in Bergamo has restored a feel-good factor at San Siro.

Bologna inflicted a significant psychological blow on Inter in Riyadh, denying Cristian Chivu a chance to fight for silverware.

Indeed, Vincenzo Italiano’s team bested the Nerazzurri after a bizarre penalty shootout, knocking them out in the semi-finals.

However, the San Siro giants got back on track on Sunday, beating Atalanta 1-0 at New Balance Arena.

MILAN, ITALY – SEPTEMBER 30: Lautaro Martinez of FC Internazionale celebrates after scoring their team’s third goal during the UEFA Champions League 2025/26 League Phase MD2 match between FC Internazionale Milano and SK Slavia Praha at Stadio San Siro on September 30, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Lautaro Martinez propelled Inter to their fourth consecutive win in Bergamo.

Furthermore, it was Inter’s fourth successive victory in Serie A, keeping them firmly at the top of the table.

Therefore, the Nerazzurri will enter the new calendar year as pacesetters, boasting a narrow one-point lead over second-placed AC Milan.

More importantly, Inter finally bucked a negative trend in high-profile clashes, posting their first ‘big-match’ win under Chivu.

title: Report – Inter Milan To Accelerate Pursuit Of Atalanta Owned Wingback Pending Key Exit Deal
description: Inter Milan could reportedly step up their pursuit of Atalanta loanee Marco Palestra in the coming weeks.According to Tuttosport via FCInterNews, Davide Frattesi’s potential exit could facilitate Pa...
fullText:
Inter Milan could reportedly step up their pursuit of Atalanta loanee Marco Palestra in the coming weeks.

According to Tuttosport via FCInterNews, Davide Frattesi’s potential exit could facilitate Palestra’s arrival.

Cristian Chivu’s charges are seemingly preparing for life after Denzel Dumfries.

Indeed, the Dutchman, currently sidelined with a long-term injury, faces an uncertain future at San Siro.

Despite his household status in Lombardy, the 29-year-old wingback could be on his way out at the end of the season.

CESENA, ITALY – OCTOBER 10: Marco Palestra of Italy U21 during the UEFA Under21 EURO Qualifier betweenItaly U21 v Sweden U21 and ad hoc Arena im Ernst-Abbe-Sportfeld on October 10, 2025 in Cesena, Italy. (Photo by Alessandro Sabattini/Getty Images)

With Dumfries expected to cut ties with Inter, the Nerazzurri have identified Marco Palestra as an ideal replacement.

However, Atalanta have slapped a prohibitive €40 million price tag on their prized asset, who’s enjoying a dream season at Cagliari.

Although Inter cannot afford such a significant figure, they could raise funds by offloading some fringe stars, including Frattesi.

Wanted by Juventus, Frattesi could leave the club in January, with Inter asking for €35 million to let him go.

title: ‘Gattuso must be supported’ in World Cup play-off, says ex-Italy star
description: Gianfranco Zola feels Gennaro Gattuso must be ‘supported, even by luck’ and that everyone ‘has to play a role’ as Italy prepare for the 2026 World Cup play-off.Italy will meet Northern Ireland...
fullText:
Gianfranco Zola feels Gennaro Gattuso must be ‘supported, even by luck’ and that everyone ‘has to play a role’ as Italy prepare for the 2026 World Cup play-off.

Italy will meet Northern Ireland in the 2026 World Cup play-off semifinal on March 26, 2026, and, if they progress to the final, they’ll face Wales or Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Italy already failed to qualify for the World Cup in 2018 and 2022, and Zola can’t fathom a repeat of that scenario.

LONDON, ENGLAND – OCTOBER 17: Gianfranco Zola is seen prior to the UEFA EURO 2024 European qualifier match between England and Italy at Wembley Stadium on October 17, 2023 in London, England. (Photo by Richard Heathcote/Getty Images)

“The history of our football can’t afford this, and therefore, everyone, including the press, has to play a role and help create the right atmosphere,” he told Gazzetta.

MILAN, ITALY – NOVEMBER 16: Referee, Alejandro Hernandez, shows a yellow card to Gennaro Gattuso, Head Coach of Italy, during the FIFA World Cup 2026 qualifier match between Italy and Norway at San Siro Stadium on November 16, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

“We’re not to be thrown away, and we weren’t before either, but we have to be there, because having already missed two was a heavy blow. Gattuso must be supported, even by luck. Some strikers can bolster the attacking strength, which is already significant with Kean and Retegui.”

title: Inter Milan Vs Napoli – Cristian Chivu To Renew Hostilities With Ex Nerazzurri Boss
description: Inter Milan boss Cristian Chivu and Napoli coach Antonio Conte will renew hostilities when the two sides face each other in mid-January.According to Tuttosport via FCInterNews, there’s a long-standi...
fullText:
Inter Milan boss Cristian Chivu and Napoli coach Antonio Conte will renew hostilities when the two sides face each other in mid-January.

According to Tuttosport via FCInterNews, there’s a long-standing animosity between the two tacticians, adding extra edge to the upcoming clash.

Everything started last season when Cristian Chivu was still in charge of Parma.

Indeed, both managers were sent off during an ill-tempered contest at Stadio Ennio Tardini.

Parma held Napoli to a scoreless draw in the penultimate round of the 2024/25 campaign.

And it didn’t sit well with Antonio Conte, who tried to confront Chivu by the touchline, resulting in both managers’ dismissals.

BOURNEMOUTH, ENGLAND – OCTOBER 29: Antonio Conte, Manager of Tottenham Hotspur, looks on during the Premier League match between AFC Bournemouth and Tottenham Hotspur at Vitality Stadium on October 29, 2022 in Bournemouth, England. (Photo by Ryan Pierse/Getty Images)

Conte attempted to poke Chivu again after Napoli’s 2-0 win over Cremonese last weekend.

However, the Nerazzurri boss paid no attention to his Partenopei counterpart’s malicious provocation.

Instead, Chivu insisted he couldn’t care less about Conte’s words, putting a firm end to their off-field rivalry.

Yet, the simmering tension between the two is sure to add an extra layer of intensity when Inter and Napoli clash in mid-January.

title: Pair Of Bruins Prospects Lead Team USA To 6-5 Win In World Juniors
description: This year’s World Junior Championship is taking place in Minneapolis, Minn., and Team USA has started the tournament 3-0 on its home ice. The United States started the tournament in style, beating Germany last Friday in commanding fashion by a score of 6-2. The next day, Team USA barely edged out Switzerland, securing a 2-1 […]
fullText:
This year’s World Junior Championship is taking place in Minneapolis, Minn., and Team USA has started the tournament 3-0 on its home ice.

The United States started the tournament in style, beating Germany last Friday in commanding fashion by a score of 6-2.

The next day, Team USA barely edged out Switzerland, securing a 2-1 victory.

The team was back in action Monday night to take on a young but exciting Slovakian team after having Sunday off.

Boston Bruins prospect Will Zellers leads the team with four goals through three games. He added a two-point performance Monday night to help beat Slovakia 6-5 in an exhilarating preliminary contest.

Zellers was a 2024 Colorado Avalanche draft pick, but found his way to the Bruins farm as a part of the deal that sent away Charlie Coyle.

He had an assist earlier in the contest, and his third-period goal put the game out of reach, securing the win for the USA.

Will Zellers (@UNDmhockey | @NHLBruins) cannot stop scoring for @usahockey, his fourth of the tournament!

📺: #WorldJuniors on NHL Network https://t.co/NTSMKsiFrB pic.twitter.com/TUpavW4cLX

— NHL Media (@NHLMedia) December 30, 2025

Zellers and Team USA would not have been in a position to win the game had it not been for the offensive contributions of Bruins draft pick James Hagens.

Hagens plays at Boston College and was the Bruins’ seventh-overall selection in the 2025 NHL Draft.

The 19-year-old centers the first line winged by Zellers and scored two of the United States’ six goals, including this one from the point to tie the game at four heading into the second intermission.

James Hagens (@BC_MHockey | @NHLBruins) will not be denied, he ties it up for @usahockey in the final minute!

📺: #WorldJuniors on NHL Network https://t.co/P4MrNIzKOs pic.twitter.com/BOKLGivD3m

— NHL Media (@NHLMedia) December 30, 2025

Team USA is back in action on Wednesday against undefeated Sweden in the final game of the preliminary round.

All games are airing on the NHL Network.

Former Bruins Star Linus Ullmark Takes Leave Of Absence For ‘Personal Reasons’

title: 3 Arsenal players make Teams of the Week
description: Three Arsenal players have made it into the various Teams of the Week for the most recent round of Premier League fixtures, following the Gunners’ win over Brighton.Photo by Shaun Botterill/Getty Im...
fullText:
Arsenal secured another three points to remain top of the Premier League table with a win over Brighton and Hove Albion at the weekend, so it’s no surprise a few of their players were selected for the various Teams of the Week.

Alan Shearer included both David Raya and Martin Odegaard in his Team of the Week on behalf of the Premier League website.

Shearer praised Raya for a “contender for Save of the Season to deny Yankuba Minteh”, and added that Odegaard “looked back to his very best” as he “led by example”.

Alan Shearer’s Premier League Team of the Week for Matchweek 18

Troy Deeney didn’t select Raya and Odegaard for his BBC Team of the Week, but he did still find a spot for an Arsenal player in Declan Rice.

Rice was used out of position at right-back for the Brighton game, but he put in a good display all the same.

Deeney wrote that despite the position change, Rice “was still massively influential, marauding forward and defensively he was solid”. He added that the midfielder “never had anyone at Brighton get at him” and “just handled every situation well”.

Troy Deeney’s BBC Team of the Week for Matchweek 18

The schedule is so packed at the moment that there’s barely time for the Premier League and the BBC to put out one Team of the Week because the next round of fixtures gets underway. Arsenal will be back in action against Aston Villa on Tuesday night.

title: Liverpool announce departure of set-piece coach Aaron Briggs
description: Liverpool have parted ways with first-team set-piece coach Aaron Briggs as the Premier League champions move to address a persistent weakness that has undermined their performances this season.The dec...
fullText:
Liverpool have parted ways with first-team set-piece coach Aaron Briggs as the Premier League champions move to address a persistent weakness that has undermined their performances this season.

The decision follows mounting frustration inside the club over Liverpool’s record at dead-ball situations, which has been among the poorest in the division despite their continued strength in open play.

Set pieces have proven costly for Arne Slot’s side, with Liverpool conceding 12 goals from such situations in the Premier League, more than any other top-flight team when penalties are excluded.

Only West Ham United have conceded more goals from corners, while Liverpool have allowed seven from that specific source alone.

At the other end of the pitch, their returns have been similarly underwhelming, with Liverpool scoring just 2.4 goals per 100 set pieces, a figure bettered only by Brentford from the wrong end of the scale.

In terms of defensive output, Liverpool are conceding 8.2 goals per 100 set pieces, with only Nottingham Forest posting a worse average.

Those issues have repeatedly altered the course of matches, most recently against Tottenham Hotspur and Wolverhampton Wanderers, when Liverpool led comfortably before conceding from set pieces and being forced into tense finishes.

Briggs joined Liverpool’s coaching staff in July 2024, initially as an individual development coach following the departure of Vitor Matos, before assuming responsibility for set pieces after the club were unable to appoint a specialist.

The appointment was adjusted last summer when Brazilian coach Luiz Fernando Iubel arrived as individual lead coach, allowing Briggs to focus solely on dead-ball situations, but the changes failed to produce the desired improvement.

Despite his reputation as a diligent and respected coach, Liverpool concluded that a change was required midway through the campaign, although the club do not view his departure as a complete solution to the problem.

There is no immediate replacement lined up, with Briggs’ duties set to be shared among existing members of Slot’s coaching staff in the short term.

Briggs arrived at Anfield after working under Niko Kovac at Wolfsburg and previously held senior analytical and coaching roles at Monaco.

He also spent nine years at Manchester City, progressing from under-18 performance analyst to a senior first-team role, with earlier experience at Blackpool and Preston North End.

title: Matthäus on Wirtz: Goal important but not 'decisive breakthrough' yet
description: The first Liverpool goal was important for Florian Wirtz but he must further improve at his new club, former Germany captain Lother Matthäus has said. Matthäus said in his Sky TV column he was happy for the playmaker that he finally found the net on Saturday against Wolverhampton Wanderers, more than four months into the season after a €150 million ($177 million) summer move from Bayer Leverkusen.
fullText:
The first Liverpool goal was important for Florian Wirtz but he must further improve at his new club, former Germany captain Lother Matthäus has said.

Matthäus said in his Sky TV column he was happy for the playmaker that he finally found the net on Saturday against Wolverhampton Wanderers, more than four months into the season after a €150 million ($177 million) summer move from Bayer Leverkusen.

But the 1990 World Cup winner added that it "wasn't the decisive breakthrough for me yet" and that Wirtz must "continue to work hard for his recognition and position.

"He is slowly becoming a man now, he must continue to fight his way through and stick his elbows out. Then he will get even more balls, be allowed to take free kicks and penalties, as he was allowed to do at Bayer and is allowed to do in the national team," Matthäus said.

Matthäus said he wasn't surprised that Wirtz needs time to adapt at Anfield and expressed confidence that he will deliver.

"He has the right attitude and his playing ability is undisputed, just as his desire to succeed together with the team. I am convinced that he will forge ahead," Matthäus said.

title: Away day blues – Barcelona begin 2026 with tough run on the road
description: Barcelona returned to training yesterday after a short festive break, and the mood around the squad is one of focus rather than celebration. With momentum on their side, the challenge now is to carry...
fullText:
Barcelona returned to training yesterday after a short festive break, and the mood around the squad is one of focus rather than celebration.

With momentum on their side, the challenge now is to carry that form into what promises to be one of the most demanding starts to a calendar year in recent memory.

To put the scale of the challenge into context, the team will not play a single match at home until the end of January.

In fact, Barça’s first six fixtures of the new year will all be away from home, a schedule that leaves little room for error.

Their competitive return begins with a derby against Espanyol on January 3 and just days later, Barcelona travel again for the Spanish Super Cup semi-final against Athletic Club on January 7.

The month continues with another difficult league assignment away to Real Sociedad on January 18, followed by a UEFA Champions League clash against Slavia Prague on January 21.

Barcelona have a tough run of games in January. (Photo by Angel Martinez/Getty Images)

Two additional fixtures could further complicate the schedule, notably, a potential Super Cup final on January 11 and a Copa del Rey round of 16 tie, scheduled between January 13 and 15.

The first match of 2026 at the Spotify Camp Nou will not arrive until the weekend of January 24–25, when Real Oviedo pay a visit. This would be a match where Camp Nou could host a bigger audience.

Barcelona will eventually close January with another home fixture, which is the final Champions League group match against Copenhagen on January 28.

There is, however, one big concern. Almost all of Barcelona’s defeats this season have come away from home.

Aside from the 1–2 loss to Paris Saint-Germain, every setback has occurred on the road, including league defeats to Sevilla and Real Madrid, as well as a Champions League loss to Chelsea.

This is why January represents a defining moment.

title: Stats Show Inter Milan Boast More Diverse Attacking Options Compared To Last Season
description: Serie A pacesetters Inter Milan have been firing on all cylinders this season, scoring more goals than any other team in the league.According to Corriere dello Sport via FCInter1908, there’s one key...
fullText:
Serie A pacesetters Inter Milan have been firing on all cylinders this season, scoring more goals than any other team in the league.

According to Corriere dello Sport via FCInter1908, there’s one key difference compared to last season.

In addition to leading the way in Serie A, Inter are the only team to have smashed a 30-goal barrier so far.

Indeed, the Nerazzurri have netted an eye-catching 35 goals in only 16 games, averaging 2.18 per game.

MILAN, ITALY – AUGUST 25: Ange-Yoan Bonny of FC Internazionale celebrates after scoring their team’s fifth goal during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and Torino FC at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on August 25, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Inter used to score at will under former manager Simone Inzaghi.

However, they’ve taken their scoring prowess to the next level this term, largely thanks to the two summer acquisitions.

Francesco Pio Esposito and Ange-Yoan Bonny have been huge upgrades on the likes of Marko Arnautovic, Mehdi Taremi, and Joaquin Correa.

For context, Inter’s frontline has scored 18 goals, the same as they did at the same stage of last season.

Yet, Lautaro Martinez and Marcus Thuram had bagged 16 of those 18 goals in the 2024/25 campaign.

On the other hand, Esposito and Bonny have relieved pressure on the standout duo, chipping in with five goals combined.

title: Drake Maye Boasts ‘It’s Harder To Light Me Up Than You Think’
description: New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is the odds-on favorite to win the NFL MVP in just his second year in the league. As such, fans would probably like to see his role blocking in the run game diminish. However, the first-year captain is beginning to make a habit of throwing a block. The quarterback […]
fullText:
New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is the odds-on favorite to win the NFL MVP in just his second year in the league.

As such, fans would probably like to see his role blocking in the run game diminish. However, the first-year captain is beginning to make a habit of throwing a block.

The quarterback told the “WEEI Afternoons” crew in a previous radio spot that he was not proud of his blocking efforts.

He was asked the same question on Monday, and Maye did his best to calm the nerves of anxious fans.

“Yeah, I don’t know what do y’all think?” Maye asked. “I thought I was alright, got in the way enough.”

The host then asked if Maye is ever worried that one of the opposing defenders is going to “light you up.”

“I mean, I’m 230 pounds, 6’5″, I think it’s a little harder to light me up than you think,” Maye said.

"I'm 230 pounds, 6'5. I think it's a little harder to light me up than you think"

Patriots quarterback Drake Maye isn't worried about getting lit up when he is throwing blocks 👀 pic.twitter.com/ClTIme7fbo

— WEEI (@WEEI) December 29, 2025

Even with four more starts made this season, Maye has yet to meet his rushing yardage mark from his rookie year, when he scampered for 421 yards on just 54 carries.

There was an offseason emphasis placed on protecting the 23-year-old gunslinger after he took several hard hits as a rookie, and it has paid off so far.

The quarterback says he feels more vulnerable in the pocket than he does throwing blocks.

“When I see the guys coming, I gotta good gist,” Maye said. “But when I’m standing there with the football like a statue, it’s a little easier for those guys to take me off my feet.”

This Concerning Stat Puts Bills’ AFC East ‘Dynasty’ In Perspective

title: Vinicius: “We know we have to improve so that 2026 is a better year for Real Madrid”
description: Real Madrid attacker Vinicius Junior talked to Real Madrid TV during Tuesday’s training session, which was open for the fans. “We know that we have to improve, so that 2026 will be a better year for everyone and especially for madridistas. I continue learning a lot within this club, with these fans, with all the […]
fullText:
Real Madrid attacker Vinicius Junior talked to Real Madrid TV during Tuesday’s training session, which was open for the fans.

“We know that we have to improve, so that 2026 will be a better year for everyone and especially for madridistas. I continue learning a lot within this club, with these fans, with all the people. We know it has not been a good year for us, but we have no doubt that we will come back, that we will win again, and that we will be at the top,” said the Brazilian attacker.

Vinicius will try to bounce back from what has been a disappointing first half of the season from him and the rest of the team. The Brazilian player has yet to sign a contract extension with the club, as his current deal expires in the summer of 2027.

title: World Darts Championship - Draw, seeds, prize money
description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at all you need to know about the 2026 PDC World Darts Championship.
fullText:
Recently crowned world number one Luke Littler is the defending champion as the 2026 PDC World Darts Championship takes place at Alexandra Palace in London.

Littler is one of nine previous winners to be playing in this year's competition and the 18-year-old is into the quarter-finals with wins over Lithuania's Darius Labanauskas, Wales' David Davies, Austria's Mensur Suljovic and England's Rob Cross.

A record 128 players entered this year's competition, an increase of 32 from last year's extravaganza, including five players from the Women's Series - also a record.

The 2026 World Darts Championship started on Thursday, 11 December and there were 13 consecutive days of action until a three-day break between 24-26 December.

The fourth round will be completed on 30 December, with another rest day on 31 December followed by the four quarter-finals across two sessions on Thursday, 1 January 2026.

After that, both semi-finals will be played on Friday, 2 January in an evening session.

The final takes place on Saturday, 3 January in the evening.

World Darts Championship 2026 schedule and results

The Luke Littler effect: Is darts now a global sport?

How do players get picked for Premier League Darts?

The top 32 ranked players were seeded for the tournament. Unlike recent years, the top 32 entered in the first round, instead of the second.

A record-breaking £5m prize pool is on offer at the tournament, with £1m going to the winner.

Any player hitting a nine-darter will be awarded an additional £60,000. One lucky fan in attendance will also receive £60,000 from the tournament sponsor, as will Prostate Cancer UK.

What is dartitis and what causes it?

Littler entered as favourite off the back of winning six major finals in 2025.

Luke Humphries, Littler's predecessor as both world champion and world number one, faced Littler in three finals this year and is the current world number two.

World number three Michael van Gerwen is also in the mix, looking to avenge last year's final defeat and add to his three world titles, with his most recent coming in 2019.

Young players making a big run at the World Championship include Josh Rock and Gian van Veen, whose respective form saw them both enter the world's top 12 before the tournament.

Beau Greaves topped this year's Women's Series and carried the highest hopes of becoming only the second female player to win a match in the tournament, after Fallon Sherrock won twice at the event in December 2019.

She took 22nd seed Daryl Gurney to a deciding set but just fell short of a place in the second round.

Three qualification places were on offer from the Women's Series, along with a spot for the Women's Matchplay winner, a title taken by Lisa Ashton.

Ashton lost 3-0 to 2023 world champion Michael Smith in the first round on 11 December.

With Greaves qualifying in her own right as runner-up on the development tour, that meant Women's Series runner-up Sherrock, Noa-Lynn van Leuven in fourth and Gemma Hayter, who finished fifth, joined third-placed Ashton.

Van Leuven, who became the first transgender player to appear at the tournament last year, was beaten by two-time champion Peter Wright this time.

Sherrock lost in straight sets in the first round to Dave Chisnall, while Hayter took a set off Northern Ireland's World Cup winner Rock in a 3-1 defeat.

The format is set play, unlike other tournaments which are a race to a number of legs.

A set consists of the best of five legs or race to three.

Only in matches where players are level on sets and legs in the deciding set do players need to win by two clear legs.

First and second round: Best of five sets

Third and fourth round: Best of seven sets

Quarter-finals: Best of nine sets

Phil Taylor is the most successful player in the history of the PDC World Darts Championship, winning 14 of his 16 world titles between 1995 and 2013.

His previous two titles came before a group of leading players broke away from the British Darts Organisation to form their own governing body, now known as the PDC, in 1993.

The past five years have produced five different world champions, with English trio Littler, Humphries and Smith winning the past three.

Littler and Humphries will hope to join the exclusive club of players to have won multiple PDC world titles, with only six managing to achieve that feat so far.

Two players hit nine-darters during the 2025 World Darts Championship.

Dutchman Christian Kist was the first player to hit one, doing so in a first-round defeat by Madars Razma.

Australia's Damon Heta hit one in the third round, but like Kist it came in a defeat as he went out to Luke Woodhouse.

Throughout the tournament, there will be daily round-ups on the BBC Sport website and app.

There will also be live text coverage of the biggest matches as the tournament progresses.

During Thursday's opening night, there was a dedicated preview show on BBC Radio 5 Live, featuring interviews with Littler, Humphries and Van Gerwen. Presenter James Gregg will provide updates on BBC Sounds throughout the competition.

This article is the latest from BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team.

Ask Me Anything is a service dedicated to answering your questions.

We want to reward your time by telling you things you do not know and reminding you of things you do.

The team will find out everything you need to know and be able to call upon a network of contacts including our experts and pundits.

We will be answering your questions from the heart of the BBC Sport newsroom, and going behind the scenes at some of the world's biggest sporting events.

Our coverage will span the BBC Sport website, app, social media and YouTube accounts, plus BBC TV and radio.

title: Fenerbahce negotiations begin as Milan and Nkunku hold firm stance
description: Negotiations between Milan and Fenerbahce for Christopher Nkunku have begun, but while the Rossoneri are only open to discussing a permanent transfer, the French forward seems unwilling to leave San S...
fullText:
Negotiations between Milan and Fenerbahce for Christopher Nkunku have begun, but while the Rossoneri are only open to discussing a permanent transfer, the French forward seems unwilling to leave San Siro in January.

Fenerbahçe have opened formal talks to sign Milan striker Nkunku in the January transfer window, according to multiple sources, including Gazzetta and Turkish transfer expert Yağız Sabuncuoğlu.

MILAN, ITALY – NOVEMBER 02: Christopher Nkunku of AC Milan runs with the ball whilst under pressure from Wesley Franca of AS Roma during the Serie A match between AC Milan and AS Roma at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on November 02, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

According to Calciomercato.com, the Turkish club are open to matching Milan’s €35m asking price, but don’t want to include Milan Skriniar in the deal.

The Rossoneri have sounded out the ex-Inter centre-back, but Fenerbahce don’t want to sell their defensive leader. Milan, on the other hand, will only discuss a permanent transfer for Nkunku.

MILAN, ITALY – SEPTEMBER 23: Christopher Nkunku of AC Milan inflates a balloon as he celebrates with teammates after scoring to give the side a 2-0 lead during the Coppa Italia Frecciarossa Round of 16 match between AC Milan and US Lecce at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on September 23, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Jonathan Moscrop/Getty Images)

Fenerbahce would need to convince Nkunku as well, given that several sources, including Ben Jacobs and Gianluca Di Marzio, say that the ex-Chelsea forward wants to stay at Milan next month, having joined the Serie A giants only a few months ago.

title: Investors Pile Into India’s Short Bonds on RBI Rate Outlook
description: Bond carry trades, which seek to profit from the gap between low funding costs and high bond yields, are growing ever more popular in India and market watchers expect the strategy to remain in vogue next year.
fullText: MarketsBy Pratigya VajpayeeSaveBond carry trades, which seek to profit from the gap between low funding costs and high bond yields, are growing ever more popular in India and market watchers expect the strategy to remain in vogue next year.Investors can pick up around 1 percentage point, the most in over two years, by borrowing overnight and using the proceeds to buy five-year notes. The Reserve Bank of India is projecting only a gradual rise in inflation toward its 4% target, fueling expectations that interest rates aren’t likely to head higher for a while.

title: Nickel Hits Nine-Month High as Indonesia Plans to Cut Output
description: Nickel hit the highest since March after top producer Indonesia flagged plans to cut supply in order to boost prices.
fullText: MarketsBy Bloomberg NewsSaveNickel hit the highest since March after top producer Indonesia flagged plans to cut supply in order to boost prices.Output will be reduced in 2026 to better match demand with supply, said Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia, according to CNBC Indonesia. The Southeast Asian country’s production of the metal, which is used in both stainless steel and electric vehicle batteries, has surged this decade to almost 70% of the world’s total.

title: Malaysia Ex-PM Muhyiddin Quits as Opposition Coalition Head
description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Muhyiddin Yassin will resign as chairman of the Perikatan Nasional opposition alliance effective Jan. 1, paving the way for a new leader to challenge Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.
fullText: MarketsBy Ram Anand and Anisah ShukrySaveFormer Malaysian Prime Minister Muhyiddin Yassin will resign as chairman of the Perikatan Nasional opposition alliance effective Jan. 1, paving the way for a new leader to challenge Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim. “I thank all the leaders of PN who have given me their full support while I was leading PN since its formation five years ago,” Muhyiddin wrote in a statement on Facebook on Tuesday. He did not provide a reason behind his decision to resign.

title: Vietnam’s GSM Weighs Overseas IPO, Eyes $20 Billion Market Value
description: Vietnamese electric-vehicle taxi operator Green & Smart Mobility JSC, which is owned by the country’s richest man, is weighing an international initial public offering that could value the company at about $20 billion.
fullText: MarketsBy Nguyen Kieu GiangSaveVietnamese electric-vehicle taxi operator Green & Smart Mobility JSC, which is owned by the country’s richest man, is weighing an international initial public offering that could value the company at about $20 billion. The company said it has been working with advisers to assess a “range of perspectives” on the IPO, but emphasized that no listing is planned for 2026. “We have plans for an IPO, but not in 2026,” GSM, as the company is known, said in an emailed statement, where it confirmed the value target.

title: Capitalism and Crime: The Books That Got Me Through the Year
description: Here’s one cold-eyed reading list.
fullText: Save To get John Authers’ newsletter delivered directly to your inbox, I’ve had many requests for a Points of Return review of the books of the year. The problem is, I’ve barely read any new books. Instead, I devoured a succession of tomes diagnosing what has gone wrong with contemporary capitalism and offering ways forward. It’s been a fascinating endeavor, and you can read the essay I wrote on the conclusions here. I didn’t review the books in that piece, so here are some brief comments on each. They’re all worth some time:

title: Russian Oil Flows to India Sink But Reliance May Limit Decline
description: Russian crude oil flows to India this month are on track to hit the lowest level in three years, though volumes may rise early next year after Reliance Industries Ltd. resumed purchases.
fullText: IndustriesEnergyBy Yongchang Chin and Rakesh SharmaSaveRussian crude oil flows to India this month are on track to hit the lowest level in three years, though volumes may rise early next year after Reliance Industries Ltd. resumed purchases.Deliveries are expected to be about 1.1 million barrels a day in December, the lowest since November 2022, according to analytics firm Kpler, which tracks shipping data. Still, that’s higher than a forecast made by Indian officials earlier this month after the latest US clampdown on Russian energy.

title: Global 2025 LNG Exports Saw Biggest Jump in Three Years, Kpler Says
description: Global exports of liquefied natural gas in 2025 likely saw the biggest jump in three years, as new supply came online in North America.
fullText: MarketsBy Sing Yee OngSaveGlobal exports of liquefied natural gas in 2025 likely saw the biggest jump in three years, as new supply came online in North America.Exports are estimated to have risen 4% from last year to 429 million tons, according to Kpler, which tracks shipping data. That’d be the largest annual increase since 2022, when exports climbed 4.5% from the year before, the data showed. The rise was largely driven by projects like LNG Canada and Plaquemines in the US ramping up output.

title: European Bank Stocks Had an Ace Year But Novo and Puma Lost Out
description: Surging metals prices and the promise of massive defense spending boosted European stocks in this record-setting year. But it was banks that stole the show, with a powerful rally that analysts are confident will extend into 2026.
fullText: MarketsBy Isabella Ward and Kwaku GyasiSaveSurging metals prices and the promise of massive defense spending boosted European stocks in this record-setting year. But it was banks that stole the show, with a powerful rally that analysts are confident will extend into 2026.Europe’s Stoxx 600 index has gained 16% this year, creating all-time highs and outpacing the S&P 500 in dollar terms along the way. Banks have led the advance, with the group soaring 65% and on track for the sharpest annual increase since 1997, thanks to strong earnings and shareholder payouts.

title: Pop Mart Shares Tumble as Renewed Labubu Demand Concerns Weigh
description: Pop Mart International Group Ltd shares slid the most in three weeks after media reports of waning reseller demand for its Labubu toys dented investor sentiment.
fullText: MarketsBy Charlotte YangSavePop Mart International Group Ltd shares slid the most in three weeks after media reports of waning reseller demand for its Labubu toys dented investor sentiment.Shares of the Hong Kong-listed firm dropped as much as 6.2% on Tuesday, making it one of the worst performers on the MSCI Asia Pacific Index. The selloff followed reports that some scalpers had paused buying Labubus after price swings in China’s secondary market signaled weakening appetite.

title: Yuan Climbs Past 7 Per Dollar Onshore for First Time Since 2023
description: The yuan strengthened beyond the key 7-per-dollar level in the more tightly controlled onshore market for the first time since 2023, signaling China’s comfort with further currency appreciation.
fullText: MarketsBy Tian Chen and Iris OuyangSaveThe yuan strengthened beyond the key 7-per-dollar level in the more tightly controlled onshore market for the first time since 2023, signaling China’s comfort with further currency appreciation.The currency rose as much as 0.2% to 6.9900 per dollar in local trading on Tuesday, amid a mild decline in the greenback and year-end foreign-exchange sales by Chinese corporates and exporters. The move came after the offshore yuan breached the closely watched 7 level last week.

title: AI Memory Demand Propels Kioxia to World’s Best-Performing Stock
description: Artificial intelligence’s insatiable appetite for data storage has delivered Japanese memory chipmaker Kioxia Holdings Corp. world-beating stock gains this year, a sign that the AI boom is alive and well despite recent market jitters.
fullText: MarketsBy Alice FrenchSaveArtificial intelligence’s insatiable appetite for data storage has delivered Japanese memory chipmaker Kioxia Holdings Corp. world-beating stock gains this year, a sign that the AI boom is alive and well despite recent market jitters.Kioxia’s shares have risen around 540% year-to-date, outperforming all other members of the MSCI World Index and making it the top stock in Japan’s Topix benchmark for 2025. The NAND flash memory maker, which only debuted on the Tokyo Stock Exchange last December, counts Apple Inc. and Microsoft Corp. among its clients and is now worth about ¥5.7 trillion ($36 billion).

title: South Koreans Cling to Ether Hoarder BitMine Despite 80% Drop
description: Ether hoarder BitMine Immersion Technologies Inc. is set to close the year as one of the most popular overseas stocks in South Korea, even after a steep decline from a July peak.
fullText: CryptoBy Sidhartha ShuklaSaveEther hoarder BitMine Immersion Technologies Inc. is set to close the year as one of the most popular overseas stocks in South Korea, even after a steep decline from a July peak. The US-listed company, backed by billionaire Peter Thiel and headed by Wall Street forecaster Tom Lee, ranks second only to Alphabet Inc. among the foreign securities most favored by South Korean investors in 2025, according to Korea Securities Depository data.

title: Baillie-Run UK Trust Seeks Clarity on Saba’s Push to Oust Board
description: Edinburgh Worldwide Investment Trust Plc pressed activist hedge fund Saba Capital Management to give more clarity on its renewed campaign to oust the board of the London-listed fund, after a similar failed move less than a year ago.
fullText: MarketsFinanceBy Sam NagarajanSaveEdinburgh Worldwide Investment Trust Plc pressed activist hedge fund Saba Capital Management to give more clarity on its renewed campaign to oust the board of the London-listed fund, after a similar failed move less than a year ago.“As shareholders consider the resolutions you have put forward, it is both reasonable and necessary that they do so with full disclosure,” EWIT Chairman Jonathan Simpson-Dent wrote in an open letter to Saba boss Boaz Weinstein on Tuesday. “Against that background, we believe you owe shareholders clear and direct answers” to certain questions they have before the vote.

title: OPEC+ Likely to Confirm Oil Production Pause, Delegates Say
description: OPEC+ is expected to stick with a planned output pause when it meets this weekend amid growing signs of global oil oversupply, three delegates said.
fullText: MarketsBy Grant Smith, Salma El Wardany, and Fiona MacDonaldSaveOPEC+ is expected to stick with a planned output pause when it meets this weekend amid growing signs of global oil oversupply, three delegates said.Key members led by Saudi Arabia and Russia will hold a monthly video conference on Jan. 4, and review a decision — first made in November — to halt further supply hikes during the first quarter after rapidly reviving production earlier this year.

title: Japan’s Topix Closes at Record Year-End High, Surpassing 1989
description: Japan’s benchmark Topix index closed at a record year-end high for 2025, surpassing even the peak 36 years ago reached during the infamous bubble economy.
fullText: MarketsBy Kentaro TsutsumiSaveJapan’s benchmark Topix index closed at a record year-end high for 2025, surpassing even the peak 36 years ago reached during the infamous bubble economy.The index closed the year’s final session at 3,408.97, higher than the 2,881.37 recorded at the end of 1989. It gained 22% in 2025, marking a third consecutive annual rise.

title: Spanish Inflation at 3% Backs Case for ECB Rate-Hold Stance
description: Spanish inflation eased in December but remained well above the euro-area average, supporting the case for the European Central Bank to keep interest rates unchanged.
fullText: EconomicsInflation & PricesBy Daniel BasteiroSaveSpanish inflation eased in December but remained well above the euro-area average, supporting the case for the European Central Bank to keep interest rates unchanged.Consumer prices rose 3% from a year earlier, down from 3.2% in November and in line with economists’ expectations, data published Tuesday showed. Inflation has been at or above 3% for four months now, after previously being under that level for more than a year.

title: Domo Chemicals Units File for Insolvency as Funding Talks Fail
description: Domo Chemicals’ German subsidiaries have filed for insolvency after talks for further short-term financing broke down.
fullText: MarketsBy Libby CherrySaveDomo Chemicals’ German subsidiaries have filed for insolvency after talks for further short-term financing broke down. The Belgium-based manufacturer of polymers and plastics has been undergoing restructuring since 2024, prompting negotiations with its bank lenders over its debt load.

title: Copper Racks Up Longest Rally Since 2017 With Bulls at the Helm
description: Copper headed for the longest winning run since 2017 in a December rally powered by the prospect of more stress in the supply chain.
fullText: MarketsBy Bloomberg NewsSaveCopper headed for the longest winning run since 2017 in a December rally powered by the prospect of more stress in the supply chain.The metal rose as much as 3% to $12,594 a ton to put it on track for a eighth day of gains, with positive sentiment showing resilience. Traders have been rushing metal to the US in anticipation of potential tariffs, tightening the market in the rest of the world.

title: Indonesian Stocks Notch Best Year Since 2014 on Retail Flows
description: Indonesian stocks recorded their best performance in 11 years, as the growing presence of local retail investors more than offset foreign fund outflows.
fullText: MarketsBy Prima WirayaniSaveIndonesian stocks recorded their best performance in 11 years, as the growing presence of local retail investors more than offset foreign fund outflows.The Jakarta Stock Exchange Composite Index was up about 22% this year, the most since 2014. It tracks gains in most regional peers, with the MSCI Asia Pacific Index advancing 26% during the period.

title: Alibaba, Abu Dhabi Set to Invest in MiniMax’s $600 Million IPO
description: Chinese artificial intelligence startup MiniMax has secured Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority as key backers in its upcoming initial public offering in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter.
fullText: MarketsAIBy Dave Sebastian and Luz DingSaveChinese artificial intelligence startup MiniMax has secured Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority as key backers in its upcoming initial public offering in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter. MiniMax is seeking to raise more than $600 million from the IPO, according to the people, who asked not to be identified because the information is private. It is set to start taking investor orders as early as Wednesday for a listing in January, some of them said.

title: There’s No Angst for Strategists About US Stocks Outlook
description: All 21 brokerage forecasters surveyed by Bloomberg see the market rising in 2026.

title: AI adoption at scale is hard. Just look at India, which processes about 20 billion transactions every month
description: The most valuable AI systems will not look dramatic. They will look ordinary. They will fade into routine decisions and familiar processes.
fullText:
Shankar Maruwada is CEO and co-founder of the EkStep Foundation. He was part of the founding team of Aadhaar, India’s digital identity program reaching more than 1.4 billion people, and as Head of Demand Generation and Communication at the Unique Identification Authority of India, he helped drive its national adoption. He has worked with governments and global institutions, including the MIT Media Lab, on population-scale digital systems. 
 Angela Chitkara is founder of the US–India Corridor, a cross-border advisory firm, and serves on the faculty of Columbia University’s School of International and Public Affairs. She advises companies and institutions on governance, risk and resilience, and workforce transformation, and has worked on India’s Aadhaar project.
